en.addInstanceSendToken:
So, you want to add your own bot. Please read the following terms carefully to avoid us banning your account:
Please choose an appropriate name and description for your bot. We do not tolerate reference links to illegal or hateful content. We also do not tolerate the use of the bot for sending unwanted messages. Do not revoke the API Key without informing us first using /apichange. Do not change any settings for the bot after your instance has been approved. You have been warned.

If you agree, create a bot in @botfather and send me the bot token.
Otherwise /cancel.
en.addInstanceSetParameters:
Alright, I have recieved a token for the bot {0}.
You can reach it @{1}.

You now need to set some parameters in @botfather using the /mybots command:

{2}

Have you done that? Then click the button below to queue your instance for approval by one of our (unpaid) staff members.
en.addInstanceParameterList:
1) Set Inline Mode to Enabled. Use any placeholder you like.

2) Set Inline Feedback to 100%.

3) Set Allow Groups to Off.
en.addInstanceBePatientText: Please be patient as our unpaid staff will review your instance. You will recieve a message telling you that your bot has been approved or rejected. The earliest time you can ask our support about the progress of your request is the {0}. Any request before that will result in your request being sent to the end of the queue.
en.addInstanceApproved: Congratulations, your instance {0} (@{1}) has been approved. You can start using it now. Be aware that changing the profile picture/name/about/description of the bot more than twice a day will result in your instance not working for 24 hours.
en.addInstanceRejected: Sorry, your instance has been rejected. It did not meet our guidelines and you can add it again in a week. Please read the instrurctions carefully next time. Reason: {0}
en.addInstanceTechnicalIssue: Please set the parameters for the bot correctly, please make sure your bot has the following parameters set: {0}. Click the button below to re-add your instance to the queue.
